In my log test I added an extra method, getLogCount() that returns the
number of lines logged.  I then log different lines at various log levels
(trace, info, warn, fatal), and then assert that the correct number of lines
have been written.
 
If you want to validate the log formatting, then redirect your output to a
StringWriter then use a regular expression library to validate the string.
 
Dave

-----Original Message-----
From: Bhavaniprasad Polimetla [mailto:bhavaniprasad.polimetla@...]
Sent: 21 May 2001 12:25
To: junit
Subject: [junit] testing flat file data


Dear sir,

I am testing "log" function.
It will write the data into predefined flat file. It wont return any
values.
Ex:
_errLog.log("testing error log.log");

How can I write the test?

Regards,
Bhavani.
